column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I was expecting a lot from this place.  Everyone told me that this was the home of the best deep dish pizza in Chicago.  We got the sausage and mushroom pizza with the butter crust
column2: and ordered it before we were seated so that it would come out faster.  When the pizza came out
column5: and served lukewarm.  The sauce was okay
column6: but it seemed that the pizza had not been cooked all the way.  Perhaps it was just a bad night for Malnati's.  Surprisingly
column7: the best thing we had was the Antipasto salad which was a little overdressed
column8: but chock full of good vegetables (surprising because no one goes to Malnati's
column10: to eat salad).  My advice is save your money and go on the architecture tour on the river.
